This movie so much reminds me of my own personal experience growing up with my Grandfather who was a survivor of the bataan death march during WWII.

War can be hell for those that go through it and back then society didn't have a mechanism to cope with the survivors who were battle scarred during the war they survived.

Today at least returning military vetrans can become police officers and inflict their rage on a civilian population which most often have lower IQ's than the general population.

Whenever I hear of a LEO beating up a housewife or unemployed idiot I at least know Grandpa didn't have this outlet available to him.

After "There Will Be Blood," I was really looking forward to this, but it's just a huge, overblown, self-righteous steaming pile of horseshit.  It just wallows in its own self-importance.

Forget linear plot - there is none (not that that is essential). It's just badly written and goes on far, far too long, and the egregiously overrated tub of lard known as Philip Seymour Hoffman totally drags is it down by never letting us, for one second, forget that he is ACTING.  Joachim Phoenix is great, but spends huge swaths of time just looking confused.  And that's it: basically a two character film that could stand to be an hour shorter. By the way, the A/V quality is superb, especially if you have a good 5.1 audio system.

And to "1batty boy," I have to ask why you feel to post numerous times that the film is long and boring - which it is - "UNLESS you are gay?"  What the fuck does that have to do with anything?  I happy to be gay and I hated every second if it ("Argo" and "Moonrise Kingdom" were my favorite films this year).  Maybe you have some issues you need to work out..  Until you get out of therapy, maybe you should keep from posting your hate speech on this board.
